templates.introInstruction:
Questions 14-18
Reading Passage 2 has seven paragraphs, A-G.
templates.formattingInstruction:

NB You may use any letter more than once.

questionBlock.question: bad outcomes for a forest when people focus only on its financial reward
reference to the aspects of any tree that contribute to its worth

examples of insects that attack trees
an alternative name for trees that produce low-use wood

templates.introInstruction: Look at the following purposes (Questions 19-21) and the list of timber cuts below.

questionBlock.question: to remove trees that are diseased
to generate income across a number of years
to create a forest whose trees are close in age

templates.formattingInstruction:
Choose ONE WORD ONLY from the passage for each answer.
Write your answers in boxes 22-26.

questionBlock.question: Some dead wood is removed to avoid the possibility of **22** ________ .
The **23** ________ from the tops of cut trees can help improve soil quality.
Some damaged trees should be left, as their **24** ________ provide habitats for a range of creatures.
Some trees that are small, such as **25** ________ , are a source of food for animals and insects.
Any trees that are **26** ________ should be left to grow, as they add to the variety of species in the forest.
